newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia seeks 50 pct stake in Timan oil project.
newsitem.headline: Russia seeks 50 pct stake in Timan oil project.

text.p: Russia will ask Western oil companies which bid to develop Timan-Pechora reserves to form a consortium in which the Russian side will have at least a 50 percent stake, a senior oil official said on Monday.

Vladimir Tumarkin, chief spokesman for Rosneft, the state oil holding firm which is being privatised, said Rosneft planned to hold talks next week with Amoco Corp, Exxon Corp and Texaco Inc of the United States, Total SA of France and Norsk Hydro ASA of Norway.
The companies had bid in a tender to develop reserves in the Khoreiverskaya Basin in Timan-Pechora in the Far North. Some were bidding together with Russian firms and some with each other.
The reserves, comprising nine proven deposits over 2,250 square km, may hold up to 200 million tonnes of oil (about 1.5 billion barrels).
Tumarkin said the fields would cost several billion dollars to develop.
